question: [File: aptos-core/sdk/src/types.rs] [Function: EphemeralPrivateKey::try_from()] [Deserialization attack] Can malicious BCS-encoded data cause buffer overflows or memory corruption during EphemeralPrivateKey deserialization? (High)
[File: aptos-core/sdk/src/types.rs] [Function: from_derive_path()] [Path depth limit] Does the derivation path parsing enforce depth limits, or can extremely deep paths cause stack overflow? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/sdk/src/types.rs] [Function: from_private_key()] [Hex length validation] Is the hex private key string validated for exact 64-character length, or can shorter/longer inputs cause issues? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/sdk/src/types.rs] [Function: extract_claims_from_jwt()] [Parts count validation] Does the code validate that JWT has exactly 3 parts, or can JWTs with more/fewer dots cause index errors? (High)

[File: aptos-core/sdk/src/types.rs] [Function: extract_header_json_from_jwt()] [First part validation] Using parts.first() instead of parts.get(0) - can this cause issues with empty JWT strings? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/sdk/src/types.rs] [Function: sign_multi_agent_with_transaction_builder()] [Error propagation] Does expect('Signing multi agent txn failed') hide underlying signing errors that should be handled? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/sdk/src/types.rs] [Function: sign_fee_payer_with_transaction_builder()] [Silent failures] Can signing failures be silently ignored due to expect(), allowing unsigned transactions to be created? (High)

[File: aptos-core/sdk/src/types.rs] [Function: sign_aa_transaction_with_transaction_builder()] [Error masking] Does expect('Signing aa txn failed') mask critical errors like invalid authenticators? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/sdk/src/types.rs] [Enum: LocalAccountAuthenticator] [Variant exhaustiveness] If new authenticator variants are added in the future, will existing match statements with unreachable!() break safely or cause security issues? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/sdk/src/types.rs] [Enum: EphemeralPrivateKey] [Variant addition] If additional key types are added, will all match statements be updated, or could unhandled variants cause panics? (Medium)
[File: aptos-core/sdk/src/types.rs] [Enum: HardwareWalletType] [Type extension] Does the code handle only Ledger, and will adding new hardware wallet types cause security regressions? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/sdk/src/types.rs] [Function: new_domain_aa()] [BCS determinism] Is BCS serialization of FunctionInfo deterministic across Rust versions and platforms, or can it produce different addresses? (High)

[File: aptos-core/sdk/src/types.rs] [Function: get_proof_from_jwt()] [BCS size limits] Does bcs::to_bytes() enforce size limits on ephemeral_key_pair.public_key to prevent DoS through large inputs? (Medium)
[File: aptos-core/sdk/src/types.rs] [Function: get_pepper_from_jwt()] [BCS encoding attack] Can malicious BCS-encoded data in prover/pepper requests exploit deserialization vulnerabilities? (High)

[File: aptos-core/sdk/src/types.rs] [Static: APT_METADATA_ADDRESS] [Initialization race] Is lazy_static initialization thread-safe in all execution environments, or can races cause incorrect APT_METADATA_ADDRESS? (Medium)
[File: aptos-core/sdk/src/types.rs] [Static: APT_METADATA_ADDRESS] [Address manipulation] Can the hardcoded address generation logic (addr[31] = 10u8) be manipulated through memory corruption? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/sdk/src/types.rs] [Function: authentication_key()] [Key type mismatch] Can switching between AnyPublicKey::keyless() and AnyPublicKey::federated_keyless() cause address derivation inconsistencies? (High)

[File: aptos-core/sdk/src/types.rs] [Function: authentication_key()] [Domain AA address] Does AuthenticationKey::domain_abstraction_address() produce collision-resistant addresses, or can attackers generate duplicate addresses? (Critical)
[File: aptos-core/sdk/src/types.rs] [Trait: CommonKeylessAccount] [Data access] Can the trait methods expose sensitive data through references that could be modified by malicious code? (Medium)
[File: aptos-core/sdk/src/types.rs] [Trait: TransactionSigner] [Interface abuse] Can implementations of TransactionSigner bypass security checks by providing malicious Result values? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/sdk/src/types.rs] [Function: build_keyless_signature()] [JWT header validation] Is jwt_header_json validated to be valid JSON and contain required fields like 'kid' and 'alg'? (High)

[File: aptos-core/sdk/src/types.rs] [Function: build_keyless_signature()] [Expiry date validation] Does exp_date_secs get validated against current time and maximum allowed expiration, or can far-future dates be used? (High)
[File: aptos-core/sdk/src/types.rs] [Lines: 108-109] [Certificate cloning] Does cloning ZeroKnowledgeSig and jwt_header_json create deep copies, or can shallow copies lead to data races? (Medium)
[File: aptos-core/sdk/src/types.rs] [Struct: EphemeralKeyPair] [Blinder entropy] Are blinders required to have sufficient entropy, or can weak blinders compromise nonce security? (High)
[File: aptos-core/sdk/src/types.rs] [Struct: KeylessAccount] [Pepper storage] Is the pepper securely stored in memory, or can it be extracted through memory dumps or swap files? (High)
